Sequence Information.Peptide Name: QUB-1426 (Synthetic AMPs, Temporin-WY2 analog, Leu-rich,  XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, local sequence shuffling, amphibians, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (71.43%) toTemporin-WY2Leu: 38%; K=A: 15%.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidatedActivity: active against Gram+ bacteria S. aureus ATCC CRM 6538 or MRSA BAA 1707 or clinical MRSA B038 V1S1 A (MIC 2 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 4 uM), Gram- E. coli NCTC 8739 or clinical BAA 2340 (MIC 4 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 or PAO1 (MIC 16-64 uM), P.aeruginosa PA14 (MIC >128 uM) , K. pneumoniae ATCC 43816 (MIC 8 uM). NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4. 5 mM), NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM), CaCl2-sensitive:E. coli (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM),  ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM). Salt-insensitive:MRSA; Salt-insensitive:E. coli.Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4. 5 mM), NH4Cl-insensitive:S. aureus (6 uM), CaCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (1 mM),  ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM).   Human serum-insensitive:MRSA (%?).Biofilms: S. aureus: Inhibited formation (MBIC 4 uM) but disruption strain-dependent (MBEC 32 to >128 uM). disrupted biofilms: E. faecalis (MBEC 32 uM).Structure:  random coils in NH4AC buffer and helical in 50% TFE.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50=16-32 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Liao F, Ye Z, Cheng J, Zhu J, Chen X, Zhou X, Wang T, Jiang Y, Ma C, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and engineering of a novel peptide, Temporin-WY2, with enhanced in vitro and in vivo efficacy against multi-drug resistant bacteria
